result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Levall Hill

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: No reply from defendant or surety.

Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 15CF1756 for the purpose of sentencing.
Defendant's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court, defendant Carlos Levall Hill not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing. Court ordered case adjourned in branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Vershawnda Pickett.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj   
Defendant is advised  case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($240.00) ad

JusticePoint Discharge Summary dated August 10, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms

Prior: 2829 W WISCONSIN AVE, Milwaukee, WI 53210

JusticePoint Pretrial Report dated August 5, 2015 received and filed.
Clerk:  jms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.  Defense counsel has no explanation for defendant's non-appearance at today's scheduled plea and sentencing hearing.
Court reviews JusticePoint report with the parties.
  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. 
Clerk:  jms
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.  (missed office contact 7/22/15)  rmm

Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for plea and sentencing.  Defense would like a short adjournment.  Court admonished defendant regarding his positive test for THC and his not keeping in contact with Justice Point.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

15RM030636  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
06-22-2015

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No contact with the victim.

Attorney Leah R. Thomas in court, defendant Carlos Levall Hill not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $240.00 cash.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with VERSHAWNDA P.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in court with attorney Bernard S. Stein.  Defendant Carlos Levall Hill in custody.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
